pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.5: 59. The training rule on transferring to another
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.2: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had transferred a robe to a monk who was his brother’s student. He then used that robe without that monk having relinquished it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.4: “Venerable Upananada is using a robe that he has transferred to me, even though I haven’t relinquished it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.5: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.6: “How can Venerable Upananda use a robe that he has transferred to a monk, when that monk hasn’t relinquished it?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.7: “Is it true, Upananda, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.10: “… Foolish man, how can you use a robe that you have transferred to a monk, when he hasn’t relinquished it?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.11: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.12: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.13.1: ‘If a monk himself transfers a robe to a monk, to a nun, to a trainee nun, to a novice monk, or to a novice nun, and he then uses it without it first being relinquished, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.8: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.10: one training for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.12: a male training in the ten training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.14: a female training in the ten training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.18: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.20: there are two kinds of transfer: transfer face-to-face and transfer in the absence of.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.22: one should say, “I transfer this robe-cloth to you” or “I transfer this robe-cloth to so-and-so.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.24: one should say, “I give this robe-cloth to you for the purpose of transfer.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.25: The other should ask, “Who is your friend or companion?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.27: The other should say, “I give it to them. Please use their property, give it away, or do as you like with it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.29: if it is not given to him or he uses it without taking it on trust, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.1: If it has not been relinquished, and he perceives that it has not, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.2: If it has not been relinquished, but he is unsure of it, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.3: If it has not been relinquished, but he perceives that it has, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.4: If he determines it or gives it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.5: If it has been relinquished, but he perceives that it has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.6: If it has been relinquished, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.7: If it has been relinquished, and he perceives that it has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.2: if the other person gives it; or
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.3: if he uses it after taking the other person’s property on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.5: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.6: The ninth rule, the training rule on transferring to another, is finished.
